intro: Lepidaploa pseudomuricata, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its leaves are hairy and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a dandelion-like head. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
